channel.title: ! operation question

item.title: ! operation question
item.dc:creator: @jSherz jSherz
item.description:
@jSherz wrote:

[quote=“zyle1992, post:8, topic:293979”][quote author=jSherz link=topic=388916.msg2906690#msg2906690 date=1249845667]
It’s because when you first spawn on TestScape your health is zero.

You can fix it by adding:

currentHealth = 99;

after

resetWalkingQueue();

in Player.java
[/quote]

Or, to be more realistic:

currentHealth = getLevelForXP(skillXP[3]);[/quote]

Silly me - I just realised that I have all of my levels at 99 on my server so it doesn’t matter… oops!

Read full topic

Or, to be more realistic:

item.title: ! operation question
item.dc:creator: @jSherz jSherz
item.description:
@jSherz wrote:

It’s because when you first spawn on TestScape your health is zero.

You can fix it by adding:

currentHealth = 99;

after

resetWalkingQueue();

in Player.java

Read full topic

item.title: ! operation question
item.dc:creator: @lukenuke75 lukenuke75
item.description:
@lukenuke75 wrote:

i have made a membership system and i want to make it so that if the player has enough money it will buy it and if he doesnt it would say not enough. my code

public void mbuy(){ if (playerIsMember == 0){ if(!playerHasItemAmount(995, 500000) == false) { sendMessage("Sorry you don't have enough money"); } else { if(playerHasItemAmount(995, 500000)== true) { playerIsMember ++; deleteItem(995, getItemSlot(995), 500000); sendMessage("You have just bought a membership"); sendMessage("Now you can do many member quest, skills, and wear members items!"); } if(playerIsMember == 1) sendMessage("you are already a member please do not abuse this system"); } }
this only makes it say you do not have enough even tho u have enough

Read full topic
